description:
Art and Climate Change


As the New Year begins parts of Australia are battling raging wildfires that many understand are a direct result of climate change. Around the world fires, floods, tropical storms, and droughts have each seen measured increase in the wake of the unrelenting consumption of natural resources and industrial pollution. Join a conversation with educators Nenette Luarca-Shoaf and Sam Ramos about whether art can play a role in helping humanity confront the global environmental crisis.

In this interactive series, the Art Institute’s encyclopedic collection serves as a catalyst for conversations about urgent social questions and current events. Come ready to participate and create community through dialogue about art.

Visit the calendar to view upcoming Intersections programs, presented on the second Friday of each month.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
